intro: Fumaria capreolata var. oscillans, commonly known as the nodding glory flower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pendulous flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom from late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed habitats.
